channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @marshallk i moved here in march 2019 from midtown manhattan. i've always wanted to live in the catskills. it's an incredible place.
@marshallk I live in a place like that in the mountains north of NYC.

the problem in tech is there is very little effective communication, esp ironic given all the bits that go over the wire.
i'm spending this year re-learning what i know about RSS and feed tech. the more i view the landscape the more i see a tragedy that no one listened to each other, no one worked together.
working together is failure of humanity, i know that sounds grandiose, but it's also true.
maybe as twitter closes the book on the musk interlude is we and they will settle in for a long haul. let's all work together to try to create a world-scale communication system which in addition to all its flaws, fosters great communication betw people of good will and ability.

@dsearls actually that's not true. i just saw a thing (i'll look for it) that explained what StackExchange's server setup looks like. this is a very highly used site among developers, immersive as you say -- and it runs on a handful of machines.
@dsearls the technology has moved forward making some old ideas obsolete.
@chasporter I only lived in cowtown for three years but it's in my blood.
On Tuesday at 10:30AM Eastern, the big reveal of the first photos from the James Webb Space Telescope. https://t.co/QcqtHZ0bqr
And what's most amazing is the Dems still think it's business as usual. https://t.co/HyJEMOEqn6
Better Call Saul restarts tomorrow night. https://t.co/pG6tfQuAqX
Twitter faces 'worst case scenario' as Elon Musk terminates purchase. https://t.co/cRTr6WNOzJ
Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer as she fights for abortion access. https://t.co/u7T6Jlg14P
Review: 'The Bear' Is the Most Stressful Thing on TV. It's Also Great. https://t.co/xi3Mo1jm73
Baidu's self-driving taxis now a common sight in Beijing. https://t.co/Jw5EaYEx6p

Biden has no sense of what the dobbs decision means for the people of the country he supported leads. He doesn’t even lead Democrats. His main function at this point is not being a Republican, which is not enough. https://t.co/nSRaSX09HM
Outrage Erupts as White House Calls Abortion Rights Activists ‘Out of Touch’. https://t.co/EAzTRwETVM
@chasporter uffdah charley 1-2-3 walleye walleye
@rushkoff the mets have won every extra innings game this year. and it sure looked like they were going to lose that one, but.. this feels like a super version of 2015.
Vote for the Ulster County "I voted" sticker. I recommend the very last one, in the lower right corner. https://t.co/eIMOnGTMyq
Mets are magic. #lgm
How Elon’s bizarre Twitter takeover saga could have just been a cover for him to sell $8.5 billion in Tesla stock. https://t.co/7rEBPbMHKr
How about some commitments from Dems of what exactly they'll do if they get what they want from voters? I don't trust them. https://t.co/ryKPReLZnx

Why would you watch MSNBC on a lovely Saturday afternoon?
This is what inspired that poll. https://t.co/cL0zrawnD7
You don't have to carry a fetus if you don't want to.

You know I never really liked beer until this summer. Something happened. A couple of beers and wow. Nice. ;-) Now when I was at UW-Madison I drank a fair amount of Point and Leinie's. But that was different.
The Voyage of the Slave Ship Sally: 1764-1765. https://t.co/Yy7izyq0gY
